I am not familiar with the workings of Vista, but your report is rather strange.  

The ";" in BOOT.INI is not allowed, it simply causes NTLDR to NOT find C:\\CMDCONS and thus throw the error.  

Is it possible that you have a wrong/defective BOOTSECT.DAT and that Vista BOOTMGR does not use the bootsector to load the XP Recovery Console (and thus works)? ![:lol:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/laugh.png)  

Something you can try:  
1) Download latest grub4dos here:  
[http://grub4dos.jot.com/WikiHome](http://grub4dos.jot.com/WikiHome "External link")  
[http://grub4dos.jot....-2008-05-07.zip](http://grub4dos.jot.com/WikiHome/grub4dos-0.4.3-2008-05-07.zip "External link")?  
2) Extract from the .zip files grldr and menu.lst and put them in the ROOT of first Active Partition (C:\\ drive)  
3) Add to BOOT.INI a line as follows:  

```
C:\grldr="Grub4dos"
```

4) Check if you have in ROOT of the drive a file called "cmldr", if not check if you have it in C:\\CMDCONS, if not check if you have a SETUPLDR.BIN in either C:\\ or C:\\CMDCONS and if yes, make a copy of it, change it's name to cmldr and place it on ROOT (C:\\ ), if you cannot find it anywhere, get SETUPLDR.BIN from your XP CD and make a copy of it to ROOT and rename it to cmldr  

Try booting, can you see the "grub4dos" entry in Vista menu?  

Get to BOOT.INI choices, choose grub4dos and in grub menu choose "find and load CMLDR, the Recovery Console of Windows NT/2K/XP".  

What happens?  

Does it boot?

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
We are trying to say the same thing in two different ways.  

You have the drive letters assigned to partitions messed up, as I supposed.  

You may note that the two screenshots give the same partitions (based on size) in the SAME order, that corresponds to their physical sequence on disk, regardless of assigned letters.  

under_XP (first screenshot you posted:  

The 5,38 Gb one is C:  
The 26,70 Gb one is D:  
The 25,01 Gb one is E:  
The 36,07 Gb one is F:  

under_Vista (second screenshot you posted):  
The 5,38 Gb one is D:  
The 26,70 Gb one is F:  
The 25,01 Gb one is C:  
The 36,07 Gb one is E:  

This is not recommended for TWO reasons:  
1) it is possible that when you boot one or the other system you delete by mistake a file on the "wrong" partition  
2) it can mess up the bootmanager(s) ![:lol:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/laugh.png)   

Now some little (hopefully) clarifications:  
1) the MBR is the MASTER Boot Record, it belongs to an entire drive, NOT to any single partition see this:  
[http://www.boot-land...topic=4476\&st=4](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/?showtopic=4476&st=4 "External link")  
2) drive lettering under NT based systems are "linked" to partitions through their addresses in the MBR partition table  
3) There is NO difference in the way XP and Vista see the partitions, only the most importamt part, i.e. assigned letters are different.  

Your problem sums to this:  
1) Vista bootmanager adds to it's menu any entry it can find on the XP BOOT.INI  
2) Whilst booting XP uses an arcpath, i.e. something like:  

```
multi(0)disk(0)rdisk(0)partition(2)\WINDOWS="Windows XP Pro" /noexecute=optin /fastdetect

multi(0)disk(0)rdisk(0)partition(1)\WINDOWS="XP Pro di base" /noexecute=optin /fastdetect
```

which is INDEPENDENT from letters assigned, but dependent on partition order on disk, these two entries will work equally well when invoked from Vista or from XP  
3) but the CMDCONS entry is drive letter\\bootsector dependent, and it will only work from one of the two booted systems.   

If I remember correctly, the C:\\CMDCONS\\BOOTSECT.DAT entry in BOOT.INI as is works when called by Vista, but it does not when called by XP.  

On the contrary, the suggested grub4dos (and menu.lst) works when called from XP, but it does not when called from Vista.  

The reason for this latter behaviour escapes me at the moment.  

You said:  
> grub4dos turns up in both the vista bootloader screen and the boot.ini following screen.  
> when you select it from the vista first screen, it gives an error and doesn't start.

Can you post details on the EXACT error it gives?   

In other words, right now I do not see ANY solution that uses the "normal" way of loading CMDCONS through BOOTSECT.DAT, short of re-installing either XP or Vista PROPERLY (which means having the same drive letters).  

There ***may*** be a solution using grub4dos. ![:thumbup:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/thumbup.gif)  

I'll think a bit about it and let you know, in the meantime, please can you post the required details on the error?  

jaclaz  

PS: can you also compress your C:\\CMDCONS\\BOOTSECT.DAT file into a .zip archive and attach it to your next post? I'd like to see what's in it.
